meanings.definition: (Latin) to strip naked, lay bare, uncover, expose
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to strip naked, lay bare, uncover, expose

examples.note: Example sentence showing the verb used with an object.

etymology.value: From de- (completely) + nudare (to make naked), from nudus (naked).

usage_notes.explanation: Denudare is a Latin verb meaning to strip bare, uncover, or expose. It is often used in contexts relating to removing covering or revealing something that was previously hidden.
